Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2014 12:17PM gk2bc0 wrote: I am experiencing the phantom itch in my armpit in the area of the SLN biopsy, and the last surgery I had there was over 6 years ago!  It  comes in waves and I try to  scratch, but to no avail, the skin is  numb and the itching is internal.  I have the same itching in my abdomen around my scar for my tram surgery, again in waves and the scar is hypertrophic since the first revision (i've had three) and it too comes in waves.   I've had the doc give me thirty steroid shots in the scar  more than once, but it doesn't help, so no point there.  Does anyone have any success in relieving this?  heat, cold?  Its been suggested that I take benadryl. Sigh, yet another daily reminder, but i am glad I am not crazy as you all have experienced this too.

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2008 10:49PM gk2bc0 wrote: LuAnn- I know exactly how you feel and the only thing I can tell you is that it will get better...even tho I could hardly believe it when the doc told me so. I had a mastectomy and TRAM reconstruction on Jun2, had emergency surgery the next day for bleeding, and required two units of blood. I never felt so weak, and experienced the same total exhaustion you did 10 days later. Fluid retention and constipation followed. A full six weeks later  I am still recovering, only to start chemo this week!  but can thoroughly emphasize with you and send tons of  positive energy your way.  I hope you will report in soon to tell  us all you are feeling better. hugs, Gail
